alert.note: Alert for Black Mesa Area; Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau; Eastern Mogollon Rim; Kaibab Plateau; Northern Gila County; Western Mogollon Rim; White Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 22 at 6:41PM MST until February 23 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches above 5000 ft and totals 8-16 inches possible above 6500ft. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Areas near Alpine, Buffalo Pass, Doney Park, Flagstaff, Forest Lakes, Fredonia, Ganado, Heber-Overgaard, Jacob Lake, Payson, Pine-Strawberry, Pinetop-Lakeside, Shonto, Show Low, Whiteriver, Williams and Window Rock. * WHEN...Until 6 PM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel will become very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow will cause areas of poor visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the Wednesday morning and evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snow will impact Coconino and Yavapai counties after 10 PM MST tonight through Wednesday afternoon, and will impact Gila, Navajo, and Apache counties from daybreak Wednesday through the early evening. Additional snow forecast from 6 PM Today to 6 PM Wednesday: Alpine 1 to 3 inches Buffalo Pass 4 to 8 inches Doney Park 6 to 10 inches Flagstaff 9 to 15 inches Forest Lakes 11 to 17 inches Fredonia 2 to 4 inches Ganado 4 to 6 inches Heber-Overgaard 4 to 8 inches Jacob Lake 4 to 8 inches Payson 6 to 10 inches Pine-Strawberry 9 to 15 inches Pinetop-Lkside 6 to 10 inches Shonto 2 to 4 inches Show Low 5 to 9 inches Whiteriver 1 to 3 inches Williams 5 to 9 inches Window Rock 3 to 5 inches.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
